CWEs: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
description: The function 'unique_name_776' is vulnerable to command injection. This is because it uses the 'exec' function to execute commands that are constructed by concatenating user-supplied input ('options' object) without properly sanitizing it. An attacker could provide malicious input that includes shell metacharacters, leading to arbitrary command execution.
